Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.model.handler

Class RuleParser

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.handler.RuleParser
public class RuleParser
extends java.lang.Object
A parser for rules defined in a domain-specific language. This class allows the user to get a list of rules based on a file written in the language defined below. The expressive power of the language is enough to represent every rule dictated by any God Effect and the standard rules.

Language specification

Main tags

The main tags define which kind of object will be described in the following lines. They should be written with a colon at their end. For example:

 rule:
     ...
  • rule: the following lines will describe the attributes of a rule, and this rule will be added to the ones that the user can get by calling the method getRules().
  • secondary rule: the following lines will describe the attributes of a rule, but this rule won't be added to the ones that the user can get by calling the method getRules(). On the contrary, this rule must be generated at least by one other rule (see parameter "generatedBy" below).
  • file: the following lines will describe another file (its path and other optional parameters) that will be parsed using another instance of this class. The rules defined in that file will be added to the ones that the user can get by calling the method getRules().
  • seocndary file: the following lines will describe another file (its path and other optional parameters) that will be parsed using another instance of this class. The rules defined in that file won't be added to the ones that the user can get by calling the method getRules(). On the contrary, they must be generated at least by one other rule (see parameter "generatedBy" below).

Rule parameters

These parameters can be specified after a "rule" main tag and need one tab of indentation. They must be written in a notation like:

     parameter = value
  • purpose: a value of the enumeration Purpose
  • actionType: a value of the enumeration ActionType
  • decision: a value of the enumeration Decision
  • target: a value of the enumeration Target
  • buildLevel: a value of the enumeration Level
  • forceSpaceFunction: a coordinate representing the destination of a "force", specified as described in the documentation of LambdaParser
  • id: a user-defined name to reference a rule uniquely (to be used for GENERATION rules
  • generatedBy: an ID that specifies which rule will generate this one. This parameter is compulsory if the rule is secondary.

Condition of the rule

The condition of the rule can be specified with the tag condition, followed by a colon. For example:

 condition:
     (condition goes here)
If the condition contains references to positions of the previous move (see oldBefore and oldAfter in LambdaParser's documentation) then the tag symbolicCondition must be used instead.
These tags require one tab of indentation, too.

File parameters

These parameters can be specified after a "file" tag and need one tab of indentation. The format is like the one of rule parameters:

 parameter = value
  • source: the path to the file
  • generatedBy: an ID that specifies which rule will generate the ones contained in this file. This parameter is compulsory if the file is secondary.
